trans-unit.source: Streaming logs and console
trans-unit.target: Streaming logs and console

trans-unit.source: Streaming logs and console overview
trans-unit.target: Streaming logs and console overview

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Portal provides an integrated streaming log viewer that lets you view tracing events from your Azure App Service web apps in real time.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Portal provides an integrated streaming log viewer that lets you view tracing events from your Azure App Service web apps in real time.

trans-unit.source: Setting this up requires a few simple steps:
trans-unit.target: Setting this up requires a few simple steps:

trans-unit.source: Write traces in your code
trans-unit.target: Write traces in your code

trans-unit.source: Enable Application Diagnostics from within the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Enable Application Diagnostics from within the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Click on the streaming logs part on the web app's blade
trans-unit.target: Click on the streaming logs part on the web app's blade

trans-unit.source: Writing traces in your code is easy.
trans-unit.target: Writing traces in your code is easy.

trans-unit.source: In C# it's as easy as writing the following code:
trans-unit.target: In C# it's as easy as writing the following code:

trans-unit.source: The Trace class lives in the System.Diagnostics namespace.
trans-unit.target: The Trace class lives in the System.Diagnostics namespace.

trans-unit.source: In a node.js app you can write this code to achieve the same result:
trans-unit.target: In a node.js app you can write this code to achieve the same result:

trans-unit.source: <linkText></linkText> Diagnostics are enabled on a per web app basis.
trans-unit.target: <linkText></linkText> Diagnostics are enabled on a per web app basis.

trans-unit.source: From within the portal click the Browse (1) button on the left menu bar and then click Web Apps (2) to get to the list (3) of all your web apps.
trans-unit.target: From within the portal click the Browse (1) button on the left menu bar and then click Web Apps (2) to get to the list (3) of all your web apps.

trans-unit.source: Click on the name of the web app that you want to configure to navigate to it.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name of the web app that you want to configure to navigate to it.

trans-unit.source: Then click Settings (1) > Diagnostic Logs (2) and turn On Application Logging (Filesystem)(3) The Level option letts you change the severity level of traces to capture.
trans-unit.target: Then click Settings (1) > Diagnostic Logs (2) and turn On Application Logging (Filesystem)(3) The Level option letts you change the severity level of traces to capture.

trans-unit.source: You should set this to Verbose if you're just trying to get familiar with the feature as this will ensure all of your trace statements get logged.
trans-unit.target: You should set this to Verbose if you're just trying to get familiar with the feature as this will ensure all of your trace statements get logged.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE at the top of the blade and you're ready to view logs.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE at the top of the blade and you're ready to view logs.

trans-unit.source: NOTE: The higher the severity level the more resources are consumed to log and the more traces you will get.
trans-unit.target: NOTE: The higher the severity level the more resources are consumed to log and the more traces you will get.

trans-unit.source: Make sure this is set to the appropriate level when using this feature for a high traffic / production site.
trans-unit.target: Make sure this is set to the appropriate level when using this feature for a high traffic / production site.

trans-unit.source: To view the streaming logs from within the portal click Tools (1) > Log Stream(2).
trans-unit.target: To view the streaming logs from within the portal click Tools (1) > Log Stream(2).

trans-unit.source: If your app is actively writing trace statements then you should see them in the resulting window in near real time.
trans-unit.target: If your app is actively writing trace statements then you should see them in the resulting window in near real time.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Portal provides console access to your web app environment.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Portal provides console access to your web app environment.

trans-unit.source: You can explore your web app's file system and run powershell/cmd scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can explore your web app's file system and run powershell/cmd scripts.

trans-unit.source: You are bound by the same permissions set as your running web app code when executing console commands.
trans-unit.target: You are bound by the same permissions set as your running web app code when executing console commands.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to access protected directories or run scripts that require elevated permissions.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to access protected directories or run scripts that require elevated permissions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText></linkText> To get to the console, browse to a web app as described in the section above.
trans-unit.target: <linkText></linkText> To get to the console, browse to a web app as described in the section above.

trans-unit.source: Click on Tools>Console and the console will open.
trans-unit.target: Click on Tools>Console and the console will open.

trans-unit.source: To get familiar with the console try basic commands like these:
trans-unit.target: To get familiar with the console try basic commands like these:
